Description: (v9.2) AWS CFT to deploy a FortiAnalyzer HA pair into an existing VPC

Label.default: Interface IP Configuration for the Cluster

VPCCIDR.Description: Provide a network CIDR for the VPC
VPCCIDR.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiAnalyzer1PrimaryIP.Description: Provide the primary IP address in CIDR form for FortiAnalyzer1 to use (IP from PublicOrPrivateSubnet1)
FortiAnalyzer1PrimaryIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiAnalyzer2PrimaryIP.Description: Provide the primary IP address in CIDR form for FortiAnalyzer2 to use (IP from PublicOrPrivateSubnet2)
FortiAnalyzer2PrimaryIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

ClusterIP.Description: Provide the secondary IP address in CIDR form for the Cluster to use (IP from PublicOrPrivateSubnet1)
ClusterIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

PubliclyAvailable.Description: Select 'Yes' if the FAZ will have an EIP to be publicly available or not.  *** If you select 'No', then an S3 endpoint needs to be deployed and reachable from the subnet the FortiAnalyzers are in to successfully bootstrap.  Also, the FortiAnalyzers require internet access to communicate with FortiCare successfully for license validation. ***

S3EndpointDeployment.Description: Select if a new S3 Endpoint should be deployed or not. If you are using public subnets and 'PubliclyAvailable' is 'Yes' then select UseExisting.  *** If the FortiAnalyzers does not have direct internet access, an S3 Endpoint should be used and associated to the subnet the FortiAnalyzers will be deployed in for successful bootstrapping. Also, the FortiAnalyzers require internet access to communicate with FortiCare successfully for license validation. ***

SubnetRouteTableID.Description: If a new S3 Endpoint is to be deployed, provide the route table ID associated with the subnet the FortiAnalyzers will be deployed in.

InstanceType.Description: Select the instance type for the FortiAnalyzers.  *** If using PAYG2Devices for LicenseType, you can only use up to a m5.xlarge. Check current Marketplace listings for PAYG options to confirm instance type selected is supported. ***

CIDRForInstanceAccess.Description: Provide a network CIDR from which the FortiAnalyzer instances will be accessed
CIDRForInstanceAccess.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

KeyPair.Description: Select a keypair to associate with the FortiAnalyzers

EncryptVolumes.Description: Select 'true' to encrypt the FortiAnalyzer instances OS and Log volumes with your account's KMS default master key for EBS.  Otherwise select false to leave unencrypted

InitS3Bucket.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the Init S3 Bucket name, where your config files will be created  *** the bucket should exist in the same region as this deployment for successful bootstrapping ***

FortiAnalyzerVersion.Description: Select the verion of FortiAnalyzer to use (latest GA AMI will be used)

LicenseType.Description: Select the license type for the FortiAnalyzers. *** PAYGSCALE is only available with 7.6.x ***

FortiAnalyzer1SerialNumber.Description: [BYOL & Flex Only, leave blank for PAYG] Provide the serial number for FortiAnalyzer1 that matches it's license (ie FAZ-VMTM00000001)

FortiAnalyzer2SerialNumber.Description: [BYOL & Flex Only, leave blank for PAYG] Provide the serial number for FortiAnalyzer2 that matches it's license (ie FAZ-VMTM00000002)

FortiAnalyzer1LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank for otherwise] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiAnalyzer1 (ie faz1.lic or prefix/faz1.lic)

FortiAnalyzer2LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank for otherwise] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiAnalyzer2 (ie faz2.lic or prefix/faz2.lic)

FortiAnalyzer1FortiFlexToken.Description: [Flex Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the FortiFlex Token for FortiAnalyzer1 (ie 1A2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J)

FortiAnalyzer2FortiFlexToken.Description: [Flex Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the FortiFlex Token for FortiAnalyzer2 (ie 2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J1K)

SecurityGroupIngress.Description: Allow local VPC access to Faz
Allow 10.0.0.0/8 access to tcp port 541 Faz
Allow 172.16.0.0/12 access to tcp port 541 Faz
Allow 192.168.0.0/16 access to tcp port 541 Faz
Allow 10.0.0.0/8 access to tcp port 514 Faz
Allow 172.16.0.0/12 access to tcp port 514 Faz
Allow 192.168.0.0/16 access to tcp port 514 Faz
Allow 10.0.0.0/8 access to udp port 514 Faz
Allow 172.16.0.0/12 access to udp port 514 Faz
Allow 192.168.0.0/16 access to udp port 514 Faz

Properties.Description: Allow FAZs to access each other (ICMP, VRRP, etc)

Fn::Join: logger.info('--> found latest AMI: {}, {}, {} {}'.format(ami_dict[ami_list[0]], ami_list[0], searchString, productCode))
logger.error('!!--> Unable to find AMI {} {} in describe_images response! {}'.format(searchString, productCode, resp))
responseData = {'msg':'Unable to find AMI {} {} in describe_images response! {}'.format(searchString, productCode,resp)}
if faz1_result is True and faz2_result is True:

Password.Value: The instance ID of each FortiAnalyzer
